critique: The document aims to address a serious threat to national security. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are fear (in adversaries), and a sense of security and confidence (joy) in the citizens. There's also an element of disgust towards the cybercrimes. There might be some surprise at the extent of the measures taken. Sadness is not a primary emotion here. The initial scores are based on this assessment. The critique is that the joy score might be too high, as the document is more about security than happiness. The revised scores reflect this.
